alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:25PM EDT until July 29 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR THE SOUTHEASTERN DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA...SOUTHEASTERN ANNE ARUNDEL...EAST CENTRAL PRINCE GEORGES AND EASTERN ARLINGTON COUNTIES... At 525 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Stevensville to South River to Andrews Air Force Base, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Bowie, Annapolis, Forestville, Largo, Coral Hills, Mayo, Shady Side, Deale, Naval Academy, Upper Marlboro, Severn River, South River, Fedex Field, Rhode River, Reagan National Airport, Nationals Park, Andrews Air Force Base, Arnold and Landover. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia.
